author: Orr, Tamra.
title: Coins and other currency : a kid's guide to coin collecting /
contents: A great gift from grandpa Joe -- From cows to coins -- From ducats to dollars -- From paper to printing presses -- From carrying to collecting -- Money around the world and in to the classroom -- Further Reading -- Books -- Web Sites for kids -- Works consulted -- On the Internet -- Glossary -- Index.

summary: Describes the world of finance, and covers earning, budgeting, saving, investing, and coin collecting; and includes the history and culture of currency from countries around the world.

author: Sommers, Michael A.,

contents: Enter the deciduous forest -- The deciduous environment -- Forest plants and animals -- Threats to the deciduous forest -- The future of the forest.
summary: An introduction to deciduous forests, discussing types of deciduous forests, their environment, plants, and animals, threats to the forests, and their future survival.

author: Raum, Elizabeth.
title: Can you survive storm chasing? : an interactive survival adventure /
contents: Amazed by weather -- Tornado! -- Hurricane! -- Flood! -- Survival guide.

summary: Readers can choose how the story ends in different adventures about survival during tornadoes, hurricanes, and flash floods.

author: Bankston, John,
title: Ancient India : Maurya Empire /

summary: Describes the Maurya Empire, discussing religion, foreign relations, money, and more. Includes a craft and recipes.

author: Wyckoff, Edwin Brit.

author: Somervill, Barbara A.
title: Clara Barton : founder of the American Red Cross /
contents: Blood flows at Antietam -- A young Clara Barton -- Early days in Washington -- The women who went to the field -- onto the battlefield -- A requiem from Andersonville -- Barton in Europe -- The scarlet cross floats -- Final days, final words.
citations: Booklist, June 2007.
summary: A brief biography of founder of the American Red Cross, Clara Barton, that chronicles her life, achievements, and persistence in providing proper care to the wounded soldiers of the Civil War.

author: Haugen, Brenda.
title: Frederick Douglass : slave, writer, abolitionist /
contents: Living with cruelty -- Growing up a slave -- Life at the great house farm -- An awakening in Baltimore -- Living with a slave breaker -- Freedom -- Frederick gets a new name -- Fighting for the Union cause -- Life after the war.
summary: Contains a biography of Frederick Douglass, the former slave turned abolitionist and author of an antislavery newspaper, and includes information on Douglass, from his childhood, to his struggles as a slave, to his leading the first all-black volunteer army in the Civil War.
subjects: African American abolitionists; African Americans; Slaves; Antislavery movements.

author: Haugen, Brenda.
title: Ulysses S. Grant : Union general and U.S. president /
contents: Finding his place in the world -- Growing up -- West Point -- Julia and the war with Mexico -- Struggling between wars -- The country divides -- Shiloh, Vicksburg, and Richmond --President Grant -- Grant's final years -- Life and times -- Ulysses S. Grant's life at a glance -- Understanding Ulysses S. Grant -- Glossary.
summary: Examines the life of Ulysses S. Grant, discussing his youth, his talent as a military leader, his role as commander of the Union Army during the Civil War, and his service to the United States as president.

author: Schoof, Heidi.
title: Elizabeth Van Lew : Civil War Spy /
contents: Gravediggers -- Southern girl -- Set the slaves free -- Prison messenger -- Spy network -- The great escape -- The fall of Richmond -- Scorned -- Honored.
summary: Presents a biography of Elizabeth Van Lew, a Union spy during the Civil War, providing soldiers with money, food, and books, and includes information on her childhood, her passion to fight slavery, and her achievements.

author: Lassieur, Allison.

author: Krohn, Katherine E.

contents: Life on Jackson Street -- Climb Every Mountain -- Amateur night -- The Jackson 5 -- Flying solo -- Humanitarian -- Ups and downs -- Final curtain call.

author: Imbriaco, Alison.
title: Causes of the Civil War : a MyReportlinks.com book /

summary: Reviews the causes of the Civil War, beginning with the settlers who arrived in Jamestown, Virginia, in 1607 not planning to own slaves, although thousands were already working in the New World. Includes Internet links to Web sites related to the Civil War.

author: Nardo, Don,
title: The Roman army : instrument of power /
contents: Rome's early enemies and expansion -- Undisputed masters of Italy -- Rome against Carthage: round one -- Rome against Carthage: round two -- Roman armies overrun Greece -- Julius Caesar conquers Gaul -- Rome's early imperial conquests -- Epilogue: the Roman army's decline.
summary: Presents an investigation of the Roman army and its role in the expansion of the Roman Empire, discussing how the military changed over the years in appearance, fighting techniques, and effectiveness.

author: Townsend, John,
title: The Asian tsunami 2004 : a huge wave kills thousands /
contents: A huge wave kills thousands: Far below the sea -- When the wave struck: Just another day -- What was known? -- The first signs -- On the beaches -- The first casualties: The damage in Indonesia -- The waves reach Thailand -- The waves reach Sri Lanka -- The damage in India and the Maldives -- Survivors: Amazing escapes -- Days at sea -- Steve's story -- Under the rubble -- The world responds: To the rescue -- A race against time -- Within weeks -- Months later -- Children of the tsunami: A disaster of the young -- Orphans of the waves -- Found -- The cost of the disaster: How much? -- Paying the price -- A knock-on effect -- Timeline.

author: Anderson, Dale,
title: Watergate : scandal in the White House /
contents: Break-in and arrests -- Nixon and politics -- The 1972 campaign -- Digging up the story -- New facts come out -- Committee hearings and court proceedings -- Nixon's fall -- After Watergate.
summary: Examines the Watergate scandal of 1972, when White House insiders broke into the Democratic National Committee's offices, discussing President Nixon's involvement, committee hearings and court proceedings, and the president's resignation.

author: Palser, Barb.
title: Hurricane Katrina : aftermath of disaster /
contents: Shelter of last resort -- Gambling against nature -- Landfall -- Days of chaos -- Help at last -- No place like home -- Tragedy's toll -- Rebirth.
citations: Booklist, December 2006.; Voice of Youth Advocates (V.O.Y.A.), June 2007.
summary: Examines the August 2005 hurricane that hit the Gulf Coast of the United States, discussing the evacuation of cities, destruction, and rescue and relief efforts; and provides a time line of events, related Web sites, and a glossary.

author: Fitzgerald, Brian,
title: McCarthyism : the Red Scare /
contents: Red alert -- The rise of communism -- The Cold War and containment -- McCarthy grabs the spotlight -- The atomic age -- The McCarthy committee -- The fall of McCarthy -- Aftermath and lessons.
citations: School Library Journal, February 2007.
summary: Examines McCarthyism, the anticommunist crusade that swept America in the late 1940s and 1950s, discussing its origin, how it operated, and its effect on American society.

author: Robinson, Matthew,
title: America debates global warming : crisis or myth? /
contents: What is global warming? -- Is global warming happening now? -- Can human beings cause global warming? -- What is the possible impact of global warming? -- Can anything be done about global warming? -- Timeline -- Glossary.
citations: School Library Journal, February 2008.; Library Media Connection, February 2008.
summary: Discusses the debate over the causes of global warming, presenting the different arguments regarding whether humans have caused it, and also covers global warming's possible impact and whether anything can be done about it.

author: Haugen, Brenda.
title: Jane Goodall : legendary primatologist /
contents: A welcome thief -- A curious child -- Africa bound -- Gombe at last -- Amazing discoveries -- A new partnership -- Disturbing discoveries -- Professor Goodall -- Making life better for chimps everywhere -- Continuing to spread the word.
summary: A biography of primatologist Jane Goodall describing her childhood in England, education and early interest in conservation, and extensive research with chimpanzees.

author: Stewart, Mark,
title: The Indian Removal Act : forced relocation /
contents: The trail where they cried -- Cultures in contact -- A new nation -- Land exchange -- A swift removal -- A matter for the courts -- Leaving the land -- Living in the West.
citations: Wilson's Junior High School, January 2010.; Booklist, May 2007.; Multicultural Review, June 2007.
summary: Profiles the "Trail of Tears," the forced removal of five Southeastern Native American tribes to land west of the Mississippi River during the winter of 1838 and 1839.
subjects: Native Americans; Forced migration; Land tenure

author: Marsico, Katie,
title: The trail of tears : the tragedy of the American Indians /
contents: The path preceding the trail -- A forced journey and a farewell to the east -- The realities of a rigorous exodus -- Short-lived peace and plenty -- Seeking rebirth in the twentieth century -- A history lesson or a living legacy?
citations: School Library Journal, January 2010.; Library Media Connection, March 2010.
summary: Provides comprehensive information on the forced removal of Native Americans from their homes to the Oklahoma Territory and its legacy.
subjects: Trail of Tears, 1838-1839.; Cherokee Indians; Cherokee Indians; Cherokee Indians

author: Byers, Ann.
title: The Trail of Tears : a primary source history of the forced relocation of the Cherokee Nation /
contents: Introduction: a nation oppressed -- Timeline -- The Cherokee Nation -- Broken promises -- Andrew Jackson -- The Cherokee's losing battle -- Removal -- "The trail where they cried" -- The trail's end -- Primary source transcriptions.
summary: Uses primary source documents, narrative, and illustrations to recount the history of the U.S. government's removal of the Cherokee from their ancestral homes in Georgia to Oklahoma in 1838.
subjects: Trail of Tears, 1838-1839; Cherokee Indians; Native Americans
series_added_entry: Primary sources in American history (New York, N.Y.)

author: Josephson, Judith Pinkerton.

author: Kerr, Jim.

author: Ravilious, Kate.

contents: Introduction -- Environmental ethics -- Power and energy -- Renewable resources -- Transportation and travel -- Wood and water -- The environment and you.

summary: Discusses both sides of the debate over various environmental issues, and covers natural resources, environmental ethics, power and energy, renewable resources, transportation, and other related topics.

author: Lantier, Patricia,
title: Harriet Tubman : conductor on the Underground Railroad /
contents: Follow the North Star! -- Growing up in slavery -- Flight to freedom -- Fearless conductor on the Underground Railroad -- Nurse, scout, spy : the Civil War -- Aftermath and legacy.

author: Gitlin, Marty.

bibliography_note: Includes bibliographical references, filmography (p. [115]-117), and index.
